Class BigCollection

A handle on a large set of Entity data. Similar to Collection, except the complete set of entities is not available directly; use stream() to read the full set. Particles wanting to operate on BigCollections should do so in the setHandles() call, since BigCollections do not trigger onHandleSync() or onHandleUpdate().

stream

  • stream(__namedParameters: object): Promise<Cursor>
    • Defined in runtime/handle.ts:435
    throws

    {Error} if this variable is not configured as a readable handle (i.e. 'in' or 'inout') in the particle's manifest.

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: object
      • forward: boolean
      • pageSize: any

    Returns Promise<Cursor>

    a Cursor instance that iterates over the full set of entities, reading pageSize entities at a time. The cursor views a snapshot of the collection, locked to the version at which the cursor is created.

    By default items are returned in order of original insertion into the collection (with the caveat that items removed during a streamed read may be returned at the end). Set forward to false to return items in reverse insertion order.
